p: They also do not recognize that when a rat colony is strongly depleted by plague, the rat fleas which have accumulated on the sharply reduced number of remaining rat hosts, will, at the death of their hosts, swarm into the immediate proximity of a household often without finding new rat hosts. They will after a brief period of starvation leap onto human inhabitants in their proximity and cause multiple quite contemporaneous infections and deaths among the human inhabitants. The assumption that this feature of contemporaneity of household infections, disease, and deaths is a reflection of human-to-human infection and “justifies the use of our model in incorporating human-to-human transmission and household structure” [ 8, cf. 59] is unwarranted and shows unfamiliarity with primary empirical plague research [ 11].
